meanings.definition: Of or relating to sound waves with frequencies below the range of human hearing.
meanings.sent1: The infrasonic waves were so low that no one could hear them.
meanings.sent2: The infrasonic noise from the earthquake was felt more than heard.
meanings.sent3: The infrasonic hum of the refrigerator made the cat curious.
meanings.sent4: The infrasonic whispers of the wind carried secrets across the valley.
meanings.sent5: The infrasonic vibrations created a mysterious atmosphere in the room.

meanings.sent1: The infrasonic device emitted waves that affected the animals.
meanings.sent2: The infrasonic generator was used to study its effects on humans.
meanings.sent3: The infrasonic machine made the room feel eerie.
meanings.sent4: The infrasonic speaker whispered a message only the dogs could hear.
meanings.sent5: The infrasonic signal caused a strange sensation in the air.

meanings.sent1: The infrasonic traveled long distances through the ground.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study infrasonic to understand seismic activity.
meanings.sent3: The infrasonic seemed to dance with the curtains in the room.
meanings.sent4: The infrasonic of the ocean could be felt in the air.
meanings.sent5: The infrasonic of the storm created a sense of foreboding.
